meanings.definition: Designed to be used once and thrown away.
meanings.sent1: The paper plates were disposable, so we didn't need to wash them.
meanings.sent2: She bought disposable razors for her trip because they were convenient.
meanings.sent3: The disposable camera captured funny moments at the party.
meanings.sent4: His friendship was disposable, easily discarded when it was no longer convenient.
meanings.sent5: The disposable gloves protected her hands during the messy task.

meanings.definition: Able to be easily replaced or discarded.
meanings.sent1: The old phone was disposable, so he upgraded to a new one.
meanings.sent2: The disposable batteries ran out quickly, but they were cheap to replace.
meanings.sent3: His excuses were as disposable as tissue paper.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him felt disposable, like a worn-out sweater.
meanings.sent5: The disposable income allowed them to splurge on a fancy dinner.

meanings.definition: A product intended to be thrown away after use.
meanings.sent1: She always kept a pack of disposable wipes in her bag.
meanings.sent2: The hospital provided disposable masks for visitors to wear.
meanings.sent3: The disposable of the year award went to the plastic water bottles.
meanings.sent4: His attitude was like a disposable, single-use item.
meanings.sent5: The disposable was left on the table after the meal.
